```{r}
#--- install.packages("e1071")
library(e1071)

# Install and load required packages
install.packages("caret")
library(caret)

loan_data <- read_csv("loan_data.csv")

nb_classifier <- naiveBayes(not.fully.paid ~ ., data = loan_data)

summary(nb_classifier)

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(65)

# Make sure 'not.fully.paid' is a factor variable
loan_data$not.fully.paid <- as.factor(loan_data$not.fully.paid)

# Split the data into training and testing sets (70% training, 30% testing)
train_index <- createDataPartition(loan_data$not.fully.paid, p = 0.7, list = FALSE)
train_data <- loan_data[train_index, ]
test_data <- loan_data[-train_index, ]

# Train the Naive Bayes classifier on the training data
nb_classifier <- naiveBayes(not.fully.paid ~ ., data = train_data)

# Make predictions on the testing data
predictions <- predict(nb_classifier, newdata = test_data)
predictions <- predict(nb_classifier, newdata = new_data)

# Evaluate performance using confusion matrix
conf_matrix <- confusionMatrix(predictions, test_data$not.fully.paid)
print(conf_matrix)


# Evaluate performance using cross-validation
cv_results <- trainControl(method = "cv", number = 20)
cv_model <- train(not.fully.paid ~ ., data = loan_data, method = "naive_bayes", trControl = cv_results)
print(cv_model)

plot(cv_model)

# Access the accuracy values for each fold
accuracy_values <- cv_model$results$Accuracy

# Plot the accuracy values
plot(accuracy_values, type = "b", xlab = "Fold", ylab = "Accuracy", main = "Cross-Validation Accuracy")

```
